summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling a remote arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell on July 14, 2020. It details the procedures for public and press audio/video access, including special provisions for alleged victims and family members, with adjustments due to COVID-19.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order schedules an arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, detailing the logistics for the upcoming remote court proceedings.

events.title: Maxwell Remote Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: A remote video/teleconference to be held for the arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Previous Court Order Issued
events.description: A previous order referenced by the court regarding courthouse access and COVID-19 protocols.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled a critical remote hearing (arraignment, initial conference, bail) for Ghislaine Maxwell for July 14, 2020.
The order provides specific phone numbers and access codes for the public and press to listen to the hearing live, with capacity for about 500 callers.
Special provisions are made for alleged victims, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. ยง 3771(a)(4), to be heard at the bail hearing and to be given private dial-in access.
Due to COVID-19, in-person viewing of the video feed at the courthouse is severely limited to approximately 60 seats to allow for social distancing.
